body_html:
I think the problem is that your code has

sess.run(init_global)
sess.run(init_local)

...before you build the network in this line:

prediction = self.network(data)

You must create the initializers and run them after you build the network, because building the network creates the variables that you need to initialize.
body_text:
I think the problem is that your code has
sess.run(init_global)
sess.run(init_local)
...before you build the network in this line:
prediction = self.network(data)
You must create the initializers and run them after you build the network, because building the network creates the variables that you need to initialize.
body:
I think the problem is that your code has

```python
sess.run(init_global)
sess.run(init_local)
```

...before you build the network in this line:

```python
prediction = self.network(data)
```

You must create the initializers and run them *after* you build the network, because building the network creates the variables that you need to initialize.
